title: Intelligent Switch Function Module
description:
SWITCH_I is an intelligent switch which automatically adjusts to the

connected switch or push-button switches. If a switch is connected, the

output follows each switching edge of the switch. However, if a push-butï¿¾ton switch is connected, SWITCH_I detects whether there is an opener or

closer, and then evaluates only the frst edge. The setup variable

T_ON_MAX determines after which time the output is switched of automa-

tically. With the SET and RST inputs the output can be switched at any

time to 100% or of. Applications are the message of smoke detectors or

alarm systems. The time T_DEBOUNCE serves to debounce the switch and

is by default set to 10ms. The time T_RESetup is used to decide whether a

close switch or break switch is connected to the input IN. If the input is for

more than this time in a state, it is assumed as rest mode.
name: SWITCH_I

input.name: SET
input.description: Input for switching the output to 100%

input.name: RST
input.description: Entrance to switch off the output

output.name: Q
output.description: Output indicating the state of the intelligent switch

return_value.description: No return value as this function handles output directly

setup.name: T_DEBOUNCE
setup.description: Debounce time for buttons, default set to 10ms

setup.name: T_RESetup
setup.description: Reconfiguration time to determine connected switch type

setup.name: T_ON_MAX
setup.description: Start limitation time after which the output is switched off automatically
